Action.Description: Activates Image Aura - Uses Triggernometry Party List
Activates Image Aura - Uses Triggernometry Party List

Folder.Name: TTS - copy this folder to startup folder

Trigger.Name: TTS Settings - move to Startup Folder
Trigger.Description:
The triggers have TTS capability that will notify you the name of the player, and the name of the skill they used. Note that if you are the player who used the skill, the TTS will not play.
To enable TTS alerts, copy the TTS folder to your startup folder, then move the TTS settings from the local TTS folder to your startup folder - do not edit or enable the table creator, and leave it inside the TTS folder. To disable all TTS, simply do not copy this trigger to your Startup folder. To disable TTS for select abilities, after copying the triggers over, click the Trigger actions tab of the local TTS Settings trigger, then disable any action related to the undesired TTS.
To add TTS for abilities not included in this trigger, copy one of the unused triggers at the bottom of the Trigger actions window. Enable the copied action. Double click the action and change the event text field, matching the formatting as provided. Save the action, then save this trigger. The ability MUST be one that is tracked by the triggers in the repo. The "Trigger ID" text must exactly match the ID of the ability. You can check this by looking at the name of the trigger that tracks it. It is also possible to restrict the TTS for certain abilities to only play based on your current role OR your current job. For example, to play "Bahamut" when a summoner summons bahamut, use this text for the event text field: [1D03] [Bahamut] To restrict the TTS to only play if you are currently a tank, use this text for the event text field: [1D03] role [tank] [Bahamut] To restrict the TTS to only play if you are currently a summoner or a scholar, use this text for the event text field: [1D03] job [SCH SMN] [Bahamut]
You can add the summoner's name to the TTS by putting [name Bahamut], or restrict it to first name with [firstname Bahamut].
Do not attempt to use both role and job based conditions for the same trigger.
Note: the AST Card TTS will only play if the card is played on you.

Trigger.Name: TTS Table Creator *leave disabled, do not edit*
Party List Settings - copy to Startup Folder

Action.Description: Party List Position - Move this aura to where you want the initial auras to appear. Note: If the pictures in this aura don't line up well in your party list, you will need to edit the vertical padding variable action, or change your party list element size in your FFXIV HUD.
Padding value - how much horizontal space to put between each icon - Default 27
Padding value - how much vertical space to put between each icon - Default 40
Aura grow direction: -1 is left, 1 is right
Width & Height value - determines the size of each icon - Default 25
Opacity value - determines the transparency of each icon - Default 100

Trigger.Name: ## INSTRUCTIONS - SEE DESCRIPTION TAB
Trigger.Description:
These triggers are based on Dansa's HoT triggers, with additional customization and functionality added by SableCentaur. 1. Make sure your party list order in FFXIV matches your configured party order in Triggernometry's settings. Telesto plugin for Dalamud is required for this repo to work properly. Please install it before trying to use this repo. https://github.com/paissaheavyindustries/Dalamud-Repo If you don't want to use Telesto, you can instead choose to populate the party list manually using the following macro: /e Player 1: <1> /e Player 2: <2> /e Player 3: <3> /e Player 4: <4> /e Player 5: <5> /e Player 6: <6> /e Player 7: <7> /e Player 8: <8> 2. Copy the Party List Settings to your Triggernometry startup folder and disable it in the remote repository. 3. Open the settings trigger and configure it. Open the Party List Position action and use the visual guide for placement to place the aura. After moving the aura to the desired location, right click the image and click Save Settings. Each of the other actions in these triggers are labeled as to what settings they change.
The triggers have TTS capability that will notify you the name of the player, and the name of the skill they used. To enable TTS alerts, copy the TTS folder from the repo's Startup folder to your Startup folder. *you must copy the FOLDER for the TTS setup to work properly* After copying the folder, move the TTS Settings trigger out of the TTS folder into the Startup folder. See the description tab of the TTS Settings trigger for instructions on configuring TTS.
To turn off auras for abilities you don't care about, find the relevant ability in folders inside the MultiCooldowns folder Enable/disable the triggers as desired. All the triggers are designed for use at level 90. I don't plan to support them at levels below that, but if you make a fix, pull requests are welcome.
Support for these triggers is limited, but questions/comments/suggestions may be DM'd to SableCentaur#1297 on Discord. If your question is answered in these instructions or in Triggernometry's FAQ, I will not answer.

Trigger.Name: ##2.07 updates - see description tab
Trigger.Description:
Planned: continue working on adding planned abilities add functionality for targetted mitigation & healing skills to show the player they are on (optional?) -> show cd on source player
10.14.2022 2.07 Moved SMN Phoenix Rekindle trackers to mitigation folder Fixed bug with Excog not being removed properly if the healing is applied too quickly after the buff is given
10.2.2022 2.06 Extended duration of auras for counters (afflatus, nadi, sen, meditation, astrodyne) to account for players that don't use them frequently (which is dumb but whatever) Added another check for players not getting added to the party list Fixed bug with emergency tactics not handling properly if the buff falls off without being used Added some death handlers for if players die while they have buffs/stacks that they will lose when they die (songs, nadi, sen/meditation, afflatus progression)
9.27.2022 2.05 Added another option for populating the party list using an in game macro, in case Telesto is down or user doesn't want to use Telesto Improved aura trigger to account for the party list being added to. Fixed bug with SMN bahamut/phoenix abilities not being removed correctly if not used during the duration of the summon Fixed bug with Phantom Kamaitachi not being properly removed when it is used
9.24.22 2.04 Added: AST Astrodyne counter AST Synastry MNK Beast Chakra counter BLM Manaward - Mitigation/Utility BLU Magic Hammer - Mitigation/Utility BRD songs BRD Dots BRD Nature's Minne - Mitigation/Utility SCH Emergency Tactics - Mitigation/Utility SCH Deployment Tactics - Mitigation/Utility MCH Automaton Queen MCH Hypercharge MCH Reassemble NIN Phantom Kamaitachi NIN Shade Shift - Mitigation/Utility SGE Pepsis - Mitigation/Utility PLD Blade of Faith/Truth/Valor counter RDM Acceleration SAM Meditation/Shoha counter SAM Meikyo Shisui SAM Sen counter SMN Elemental Attunement SMN Enkindle SMN Primal Favors SMN Primal Summons SMN Rekindle WHM Afflatus counter Sprint Surecast
optimized AST card logic
9.22.22 2.03 fixed bug with party order adjusted DRK living dead & DNC technical step to be more consistent (and so that DRK living dead won't fire the TTS alert twice) added support for RDM melee combos at 50 and 80 added trigger to cancel the melee aura if the RDM dies during their combo adjusted SAM ikishoten/ogi namikuri ready to be more consistent with other triggers added check to ensure duplicates of abilities are not getting added to the aura lists (which creates empty spaces) moved SCH's dissipation to the personal cd folder, since they were the only job that didn't have any at all lol moved DNC's standard step to personal cd folder
9.20.22 2.02 added TTS capability & customization options w/ documentation & instructions to configure TTS, please see the description tab of the TTS Settings trigger in the startup folder! moved all triggers to using ability IDs instead of ability names cleaned up disabled actions fixed some bugs with oblation, technical step/finish, and RDM melee combo sort cooldown lists to have active abilities at the start of the list (closest to the party list) then move them to the farthest space when the ability is on cooldown
9.17.22 2.01 revamped RDM melee combo; now tracks the gcds instead of showing an arbitrary timer will cancel itself if the RDM breaks their combo by casting a spell or letting their combo fall off added trick attack adjusted cd initialize trigger to better accomodate for "counter" cds, now is less likely to erroneously clear variables removed references to player names in variables and trigger logic; still needs to be removed from regex
9.16.22 2.00 added functionality for "counter" abilities when buff is active, aura shows number of stacks remaining instead of duration left when buff falls off, aura will switch to showing CD ex. Soteria, Manafication, Delirium, Blood Weapon, Requiescat. also affects Technical Step added functionality for other abilities that can end early but don't have stacks when buff is active, aura shows time left until it ends automatically when buff falls off or ability is ended, aura will switch to showing CD for abilities that trigger other buffs (regen from arcane crest, invuln from living dead, etc), these effects will show up as a separate aura from the original ability's cooldown ex. Macrocosmos, Earthly Star, Living Dead, Arcane Crest, Divine Veil added customizability to party list settings new options include changing the width/height and opacity of icons text size customizability is impossible for now :( to use these new options, copy and paste a new copy of the Party List Settings trigger to the startup folder and customize as desired actions with multiple charges now use a single trigger to queue aura activation most of these triggers still have disabled actions, will clean these up later after ensuring consistency as a result of this change, there are much fewer messy variables left over when exiting duties! removed outdated references to DoT tracker simplified HoT logic converted all triggers to use network lines added Telesto compatibility to allow for continued use until Trig party data populates correctly again https://github.com/paissaheavyindustries/Triggernometry/issues/71 if/when this is fixed, it should be possible to go back to using it without Telesto with no updates needed updated level requirement to show Kerachole as a regen for SGE added new abilities to track AST - Draw, Exaltation, BLM - Amplifier, PLD - Divine Veil, SGE - Physis added wipe command to allow easier testing and cleanup reorganized folders to make abilities easier to find, and backend/aura commands less intrusive updated instructions fixed bug with reprisal
